title: Quiz of the Week: How did the Queen fare on the rich list?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: 'Sharks everywhere': Angler films feeding frenzy in Australia
description: An Australian fisherman says he was stunned to come across dozens of sharks feeding in shallow waters.

title: Keith Urban on his lockdown drive-in concert
description: The US country music star performed to healthcare workers in their cars in Tennessee.

title: Coronavirus: Could there be a second wave?
description: What factors determine a potential second wave of Covid-19 infections?

title: Get ready for the 'holy grail' of computer graphics
description: Ray tracing produces stunning lighting effects but has been too complex for computers, until now.

title: Eid in lockdown: Muslim influencers share their style tips
description: Three Muslim influencers share their style tips, as millions prepare to celebrate the end of Ramadan.

title: How bumble bees trick plants into flowering early
description: It's the first time scientists have observed this behaviour, which bees do when pollen is scarce.

title: Coronavirus: William and Kate join care home bingo session in video call
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are drafted in as bingo callers in a video call to a care home.

title: 'Absolutely huge' sinkhole appears on Walsall road
description: A politician says it "looks like a meteor has hit" Stafford Street in Walsall.

title: Robot dog tries to herd sheep
description: The Spot robot was designed for search and rescue - but may find work in the farming industry.

title: Leaving lockdown in Scotland: What can you do - and when?
description: Scotland's plan for exiting lockdown will be in four phases. So, what's happening with schools, pubs, hairdressers and gyms?

title: Coronavirus: Will camping be on the cards this summer?
description: Bookings surge as a minister hints "staycations" might be possible - but site owners voice concerns.

title: Amazon under threat: Fires, loggers and now virus
description: How the loss of the Amazon goes beyond deforestation - and what the nine countries that share this natural resource are doing to protect it.

title: Harry Potter first edition found in skip sells for £33,000
description: An expert says the hardback Philosopher's Stone first edition is "the Holy Grail" for collectors.

title: Orphaned deer kid saved from Hatfield Moors fire
description: The baby roe deer was found collapsed in shrubs and needed reviving with oxygen.

title: Coronavirus: Couple's 'incredible' virtual New York trip
description: Barbara and Ed Higgins missed out on a dream holiday - but still "went" on it, thanks to their family.

title: Emmerdale to show characters dealing with lockdown
description: The soap has begun its "phased return to filming", after coming to a halt in March due to Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Time short on test, track and trace - NHS leaders
description: The NHS Confederation warns of "severe" consequences if the right system is not established quickly.

title: Boris Johnson will not face criminal investigation over Jennifer Arcuri
description: Police watchdog clears Boris Johnson over his dealings with US businesswoman Jennifer Arcuri.

title: Coronavirus: French brothers strike gold under lockdown
description: Two children, aged about 10, make a valuable discovery as they build a shelter in their garden.

title: UK migration: Net migration from outside EU hits 'highest level'
description: Official figures show an estimated 282,000 more non-EU citizens came to the UK than left in 2019.

title: Ring lost in Tenbury Wells floods returned to owner
description: A metal detectorist finds the jewellery in a field three months on after a social media appeal.

title: Coronavirus: Alarm as crowds flock to European beaches
description: Authorities in France, the Netherlands and UK urged people to observe social-distancing rules.

title: Coronavirus: Scottish lockdown easing to begin next week
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon unveils a four-phase "route map" aimed at relaxing the coronavirus restrictions.

title: Coronavirus: Care home testing speed questioned by commissioner
description: The older people's commissioner calls for an investigation into the Welsh Government's speed of testing in care homes.

title: 'Sadder than dancing with your sister' - Spain boss on football without fans
description: Playing matches behind closed doors is "sadder than dancing with your sister", says Spain manager Luis Enrique.

title: Amphan: Kolkata devastated as cyclone leaves scores dead
description: One of India's major cities is reeling as more than 80 deaths are confirmed along the Bengal coast.

title: Eleven transgender inmates sexually assaulted in male prisons last year
description: The Ministry of Justice figures cover inmates who are legally male but self-identify as female.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg defends actions on virus misinformation
description: Facebook's founder Mark Zuckerberg tells the BBC it will remove content likely to result in "imminent harm".

title: Coronavirus: EasyJet to resume flights in June
description: EasyJet says it will restart a "small number" of domestic UK routes from airports including Gatwick.

title: 'Would I return to training? No way, no chance'
description: The ex-Wales striker says there is "no way" he would return to train or play unless his safety from Covid-19 was guaranteed.

title: Coronavirus: When will I be able to go on holiday?
description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

title: Vote for your best British women's sport moment of all time
description: With the continued absence of live sport, we reminisce about some of the best British women's sport moments and ask you to vote for yours.

title: Awkward car rides & hiding a World Cup medal - Cross & Hartley on mental effects of life on sidelines
description: England bowlers Kate Cross and Alex Hartley discuss the mental health effects of life on the sidelines of international cricket.

title: Tony Hadley, a radio quiz, one syllable - and a $10,000 riddle
description: When a Singaporean quizzer lost a huge cash prize over one syllable, he got some unlikely help.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Trace against time' as thousands flock to beaches
description: The government's promised track and trace system features on many of Thursday's front pages.
